variants.Description in input context: This variant causes a change from glutamine (Q) to histidine (H) at position 608 of the Lamin A/C protein.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line expressing wild-type Lamin A/C and mutant Lamin A/C (c.1824C>T) proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: The mutant Lamin A/C protein (c.1824C>T) was found to migrate differently on the gel, suggesting an altered conformation. Furthermore, quantification of the band intensity showed a 30% increase in the expression level of the mutant protein compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for quantification purposes.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type Lamin A/C protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No negative control was mentioned in the literature.

Validation controls B/LB.Description: A benign variant of Lamin A/C was used as a validation control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA with Dunnett's post-test was used to compare the expression levels of wild-type and mutant Lamin A/C proteins.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: The expected band intensity for wild-type Lamin A/C protein is between x and y (values not provided in the literature).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Any significant deviation from the expected band intensity or migration pattern of wild-type Lamin A/C protein is considered abnormal.
